DOC.brief_title: Neural Compensation , Visual Function Visual Quality After Monofocal Multifocal Intraocular Lens Implantation
DOC.detailed_description: Cataract extraction intraocular lens ( IOL ) implantation current standard treatment age-related cataract ( ARC ) . Cataract surgery increase visual acuity may lead complaint surgery . Multifocal intraocular lens ( MIOLs ) provide enhance far near visual acuity , bring halo glare , cause design deficiency IOLs . Fortunately , halo glare diminish time . Niels et al noted neural adaptation ( NA ) may explain low incidence glare halo study . Compared monofocal intraocular lens , pseudo accommodation nonphysiological state may increase difficulty neural compensation reconstruction patient multifocal intraocular lens implantation . In present study , investigator evaluate activity neuron visual cortex use fMRI preoperatively postoperatively . In addition , investigator evaluate postoperative change VF , include visual acuity ( VA ) , contrast sensitivity ( CS ) , straylight value ( SVs ) , pattern visual evoke potential ( PVEP ) , stereoscopic vision , wavefront aberration 1 week , 3 month , 6 month , 12 month postoperatively.In trial , investigator aim specify time neural compensation reconstruction patient explore change visual function senile patient monofocal multifocal intraocular lens implantation .
